frame.name: Spelling_and_pronouncing
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> realizes a <fen>Sign</fen>, usually a linguistic one, in some <fen>Formal_realization</fen>. The <fen>Formal_realization</fen> may be described as correct or incorrect in a <fen>Judgment</fen> expression, or it may be partially indicated as a <fen>Part_of_form</fen>. <fen>Manner</fen> may be used as a more general indication of the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>
<ex><fex name="spe">A person</fex> doesn't always <t>pronounce</t> <fex name="sig">a word</fex> <fex name="man">the way they say it in context</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="spe">I</fex> can't <t>spell</t>. <fex name="sig">INI</fex> <fex name="jud">INI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="spe">Stephanopolous</fex> <t>spells</t> <fex name="sig">his name</fex> <fex name="pof">with a "ph"</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="cxt">On page 87465</fex>, <fex name="spe">you</fex> <t>spelled</t> <fex name="sig">the name of my dog</fex> <fex name="jud">incorrectly</fex> <fex name="for">as "Checquers"</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="cxt">In German</fex>, <fex name="sig">the word for 'peace'</fex> is <t>written</t> <fex name="for">"Friede"</fex> <fex name="spe">CNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition:
<def-root>The language user who produces a <fen>Sign</fen> in some modality.
<ex><fex name="spe">He</fex> insists on <t>mispronouncing</t> my name every time, the bastard!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Sign
FE.definition:
<def-root>An abstract form-meaning pairing.
<ex>My little nephew can't <t>say</t> <fex name="sig">prestidigitation</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Judgment
FE.definition:
<def-root>An evaluation of whether the <fen>Formal_realization</fen> that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produced matches the standard or standard range.
<ex>Finally, I would pay more attention to your "oppinion" if you <t>spelled</t> it <fex name="jud">correctly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Formal_realization
FE.definition:
<def-root>The written string, gesture, or vocalized sound sequence that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces.
<ex>The old uncensored editions of the Talmud referred to Jesus as Yeshua censored versions <t>spelled</t> it <fex name="for">as Yeshu</fex> </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part_of_form
FE.definition:
<def-root>A constituent part of the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
<ex>You spelled it <fex name="pof">with a "t"</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The way that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
<ex>You <t>spelled</t> it <fex name="man">the way it sounds</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time when the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
<ex><fex name="zeit">Today</fex> you <t>spelled</t> it "pjuok". </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Textual_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The context wherein the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces a particular <fen>Formal_realization</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Textual_location">On page 1223</fex>, you <t>spelled</t> her name wrong. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person that the <fen>Speaker</fen> is producing the <fen>Formal_realization</fen> for.
<ex>So I asked the ladies down in the kitchen if they could maybe <t>pronounce</t> your name <fex name="add">for me</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>Denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically followes.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of times the <fen>Sign</fen> is spelled or pronounced per some unit of time.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE marks any state that the <fen>Speaker</fen> is in while spelling or pronouncing.</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: spell.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: write or name the letters that form (a word)

lexUnit.name: pronounce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make the sound of (a word or part of a word).

lexUnit.name: write.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: create a linguistic form by writing.

lexUnit.name: sound.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a unit of sound produced by language users, into which meaning can be encoded
